category_summary:
**Ethan Emollick** dominated today's discourse with a [paradigm-shifting frame](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-c555c9a0f768): managing AI agents is fundamentally a management problem—specifying goals, dividing tasks, providing feedback—not a coding exercise. **Greg Brockman** (OpenAI co-founder) [endorsed this view](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-d1db21303a76), signaling industry alignment on management skills becoming essential for AI work.

- **svpino** offered a [sharp insight](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-97db91b3b6d8): AI accelerates both good and bad code patterns—clean codebases flourish while messy ones decay faster
- **François Chollet** (ARC creator) [drew connections](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-b01845eb3862) between child cognition and AI abstraction, while [critiquing static benchmarks](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-f954a5f0072a) as fundamentally gameable
- **Boris Cherny** (Anthropic) shared practical Claude Code architecture—[running agents in separate git checkouts](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-2845dd760324) and implementing [AI-first code review](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-ab91e6275456) in CI pipelines

**Jerry Liu** (LlamaIndex CEO) [announced **LlamaSheets**](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-dc5dbe1c6a74) to address LLM struggles with messy Excel data. **Andriy Burkov** [praised Claude](/?date=2026-01-04&category=social#item-4580d445ec48) for beating benchmarks without fine-tuning on them—a signal of true model quality over benchmark gaming.
category_summary_html:
Ethan Emollick dominated today's discourse with a paradigm-shifting frame: managing AI agents is fundamentally a management problem—specifying goals, dividing tasks, providing feedback—not a coding exercise. Greg Brockman (OpenAI co-founder) endorsed this view, signaling industry alignment on management skills becoming essential for AI work.

  • svpino offered a sharp insight: AI accelerates both good and bad code patterns—clean codebases flourish while messy ones decay faster
  • François Chollet (ARC creator) drew connections between child cognition and AI abstraction, while critiquing static benchmarks as fundamentally gameable
  • Boris Cherny (Anthropic) shared practical Claude Code architecture—running agents in separate git checkouts and implementing AI-first code review in CI pipelines

Jerry Liu (LlamaIndex CEO) announced LlamaSheets to address LLM struggles with messy Excel data. Andriy Burkov praised Claude for beating benchmarks without fine-tuning on them—a signal of true model quality over benchmark gaming.

items.title: LLMs/general agents still struggle to make sense of messy and complex Excel data. You can't easily d...
items.content:
LLMs/general agents still struggle to make sense of messy and complex Excel data. You can't easily dump all cells into the context window, and using the code interpreter is inefficient. 

LlamaSheets is one of my favorite releases from last year. We've embarked on an effort to build state-of-the-art algorithms and models to segment and parse complex Excel tables - including merged cells, hierarchical rows/columns. This includes both sheet-level and table-level understanding.

We think there's a ton of use cases that this can help solve (simplest example: structuring your income/P&L/cash statements to be LLM-ready), and we'd love to get your feedback.

Come check it out and let us know your thoughts! 

Sign up: https://t.co/XYZmx5TFz8
Docs: https://t.co/w0FHd19W3C
items.author: @jerryjliu0
items.summary: Jerry Liu (LlamaIndex CEO) announces LlamaSheets for parsing complex Excel data that LLMs struggle with, including merged cells and hierarchical structures
items.reasoning: Significant product announcement from major AI framework CEO addressing real LLM limitation, practical use cases mentioned, high engagement (30K views, 406 likes)

items.title: The fact that Claude still beats most of other models in benchmarks without being finetuned to these...
items.content:
The fact that Claude still beats most of other models in benchmarks without being finetuned to these benchmarks is what I find especially mind-blowing.

As I have been consistently posting for years, you can finetune a transformer to beat any benchmark provided enough similar examples. Only if you don't try to do that and still beat most of them, your model is truly good.

items.title: @kimmonismus I keep hearing that Meta is in a deep cultural problem, and this is just more evidence ...
items.content:
@kimmonismus I keep hearing that Meta is in a deep cultural problem, and this is just more evidence of it. Their Ray-Bans with displays are a disaster, and I judge companies by the products they bring to market. 

Meta is in real trouble. They are about to get hit by new products from Google, Apple, and others, and I don't believe they're going to recover for a few reasons:
1. They just don't have the data.
2. They don't have the trust.
3. They don't have the content that is going to separate them from the others. 

It is the content that is soon going to matter. The indictment of the Meta Ray-Bans with displays is that there was only one video game on them after spending tens of billions of dollars. To me, that's the indictment. The culture is messed up, the products are messed up, and my bet is on somebody else.
items.author: @Scobleizer
items.summary: Scobleizer's detailed criticism of Meta's AR/VR strategy citing cultural problems, lack of content, data, and trust
items.reasoning: High engagement (188 likes, 43K views), substantive industry analysis with specific critiques about Meta's Ray-Ban displays having only one game after billions invested

items.title: @OopsGuess @buherithomas I just had several rides in BYD. And visited them at CES last year. Was at ...
items.content:
@OopsGuess @buherithomas I just had several rides in BYD. And visited them at CES last year. Was at Zeekr's press conference there too and talk with many Chinese working in both tech and automotive. Well aware of how they are innovating. 

Behind on autonomy but ahead on putting better screens and seats in their cars. 

The innovation I'm jealous of is Nio's suspension that sees bumps in the road and adjusts the suspension in real time to get rid of them. That's real innovation. And Zeekr's battery tech that lets it charge to 80% in eight minutes. 

Here's an interview I did last week with a Chinese entrepreneur: https://t.co/Jyu5Roj7Tu

I'm actually more on your side than against. Just wanted to provide some balance to your reporting.

Sora 2 simulates physical logic instead of approximating it.

That means:

→ Movement with real torq...
items.content:
Sora 2 simulates physical logic instead of approximating it.

That means:

→ Movement with real torque and momentum
→ Lighting and spatial layout that stay consistent across scenes
→ Water, weight, and collision that behave like the real world

It feels less like generation and more like environment design.

items.title:
@OopsGuess @boundedChannel Sorry, that was a copy of eBay. 

Renren (formerly known as Xiaonei) was ...
items.content:
@OopsGuess @boundedChannel Sorry, that was a copy of eBay. 

Renren (formerly known as Xiaonei) was the Chinese social network widely regarded as a direct copy of Facebook in its early days.

Launched in December 2005 as Xiaonei (meaning "on-campus network"), it began as a campus-focused platform targeting university students—mirroring Facebook's origins—with an almost identical blue-and-white design, layout, features (like profiles, friend connections, and photo sharing), and even pixel-level similarities. It was explicitly described as a "Facebook clone" or "pixel-to-pixel copy" in numerous reports from the era.

After being acquired in 2006 and rebranded to Renren (meaning "everyone's network") in 2009 to broaden its appeal, it became known as "China's Facebook" or the "failed Chinese Facebook." It gained massive popularity among students and young users, especially after Facebook was blocked in China in 2009, but later declined with the rise of mobile apps like WeChat and Weibo.

While other platforms like Kaixin001 also competed in the social networking space (often with similar games and features), Renren/Xiaonei is consistently cited as the earliest and most direct early-days copy of Facebook's model.
items.author: @Scobleizer
items.summary: Detailed history of Renren as early Facebook clone in China, firewall dynamics
items.reasoning: Historical context on tech copying and China's great firewall strategy

items.title:
Studying should not be easy if you want it to leave a lasting effect on your brain.

On the other ha...
items.content:
Studying should not be easy if you want it to leave a lasting effect on your brain.

On the other hand, the difficulty of studying must be just hard enough so that you are never blocked.

This is exactly what @ChapterPal does: you learn about computing and AI from reading books instead of listening to podcasts, you are challenged with quizzes and puzzles regularly, and you have access to an AI tutor when blocked.

This is an optimal combination of not too easy and not too hard.

Two months since the launch, the app has just crossed 3,000 registered users. If you are about to start learning something, you should try ChapterPal.

items.title: 💸 I now passed $100,000 made from shitposting since X started to pay me for posting in April last ye...
items.content:
💸 I now passed $100,000 made from shitposting since X started to pay me for posting in April last year!

This month was another $10,000 month:

$8,293 ad rev share
$1,218 subs revenue

(=$9,511 per 28 days)

= $10,360/month

The rise in views/followers was mostly related to my trip to Singapore, Japan and especially China

I posted a lot of stories and videos (and still have a few I have to post soon) which also helped get to 120,000,000 monthly views with almost 50,000 new followers in a month too, both records for me I think

I don't think it fully paid for the trip though (it doesn't have to) but we are getting somewhat close to where it actually could pay for it, which is cool because that means you can really have paid citizen journalism on here!

What's interesting about the Venezuela operation: after this South America is almost completely right wing and allied to the US

And except for Colombia, Brazil too is now completely surrounded by them

Brazil is ruled by Lula, a self declared Communist, and a far-left leader who likes to ally himself more with Russia, China and Iran than the US

Maybe what the US is trying to do here is create a new Pax Americana with a North and South America that's completely allied with the US

Which they could call making (greater) America great again

items.title:
Christianity - White Nativity Scene 

You are invited to attend the Annual Christmas Concert at the ...
items.content:
Christianity - White Nativity Scene 

You are invited to attend the Annual Christmas Concert at the Church of the Nativity on Sunday, Dec. 8, at 1:30 p.m. in the Church Sanctuary. The Nativity Choir, an ensemble of San Diego’s finest vocalists, will be joined by San Diego Baroque, a collaborative ensemble made up of some of the area’s finest early music specialists with Dr. Alison Luedecke as the music director. Admission is free, and there will be a freewill offering, with all proceeds going to support the Nativity Music Program.

Discover the beauty of Mary’s journey from the Annunciation to the miraculous birth of Jesus at our Annual Christmas Concert. White Nativity Scene, Inspired by the statue of Mary, Dr. Alison Luedecke envisioned a program that presents the Christmas story through her eyes, allowing us to experience this sacred narrative in a deeply personal way. Join us for an unforgettable afternoon filled with meaningful music and reflections that celebrate the essence of the season. Don't miss this opportunity to connect with the spirit of Christmas in a whole new light!

San Diego Union-Tribune. (2024, November 21). White nativity scene. Retrieved November 24, 2024, from https://t.co/hk8WLBqsXm

items.summary: Post about Christmas concert at Church of the Nativity - completely off-topic religious event promotion
